content.description: Same start as "It's in the Bone" on the low jug. Big move out to the tip of the arete and either continue around the corner (left) and then top-out or continue up the arete and slightly right for an earlier exit. Felt the same grade either way. I enjoyed the left exit better, as it flowed nicely. Careful of some loose rock on this section of the boulder.
content.location: Located down in The Nest. Same start as "It's in the Bone"

content.description: Start almost from a sit at the very bottom of the arête. Find some good holds and pull on. Move right along the lip and top out at the peak.
content.location: In the nest area below the quarry cliffs. The route faces up the talus hill. Same boulder as gypsy tears and spread em just on the opposite side

content.description: start matched on an obvious rail with a left toe hook, work your way left through good holds and tricky foot beta, find a crimp and either dyno to the finish or use the arete. The dyno from the crimp makes it a grade harder.
content.location: further down the trail next to the quarried cliff, there is a cluster of boulders down the hill I have been calling this area the nest.

content.description: This problem (and boulder) Is a bit chossy. Head straight up the flake on the arete to the bomber handle up by the sapling. The feet at first aren’t great.
content.location: On the Nest Boulders at the bottom of the quarry scree.

content.description: Start super low on a jug do a big lock off to an awful two finger crystal crimp (sharp) then trust a bad foot and hope it doesn't pop or your shin is going to be hurting hence the name.    went there today and the crimp felt like its going to break.
content.location: In the nest located on a different boulder just to the left of spread spread em

content.description: There's two nice jugs to start on. Use a high left toe and launch up to the top lip. Traverse left or right to top out or press it out to make it a little more difficult.  Nice fun easy problem.
content.location: Located in the nest area below the quarry cliffs

content.description: Start on an obvious crimp rail same as spread em but use different feet and got straight up using a weird gaston then try to grab the jug without dabbing the tree.
content.location: in the nest area same start as spread em

content.description: Sit start RH on a crimp high up LH on a low slot. pull up work your way up and right through good edges.
content.location: same boulder as Its the bone, located on the right arete.

content.description: A couple okay boulders sit below the quarried cliff. Very shady and surrounded by mountain laurel with some choss. Pretty good flat landings. Good if you’re looking for something besides the prow.
